name: Hydrogen
info: Atomic Number: 1. Lightest element, colorless gas, used in rocket fuel and the Sun's fusion.

name: Helium
info: Atomic Number: 2. Noble gas, inert, used in balloons and cooling superconducting magnets.

name: Lithium
info: Atomic Number: 3. Soft metal, used in rechargeable batteries.

name: Beryllium
info: Atomic Number: 4. Strong, lightweight metal, used in aerospace and military applications.

name: Boron
info: Atomic Number: 5. Metalloid, used in glass and ceramics, enhances strength and heat resistance.

name: Carbon
info: Atomic Number: 6. Fundamental building block of life, found in diamonds and graphite.

name: Nitrogen
info: Atomic Number: 7. Colorless, odorless gas, makes up 78% of Earth's atmosphere.

name: Oxygen
info: Atomic Number: 8. Essential for respiration, reactive element, supports combustion.

name: Fluorine
info: Atomic Number: 9. Highly reactive, used in toothpaste and Teflon.

name: Neon
info: Atomic Number: 10. Noble gas, emits red-orange glow, used in neon signs.

name: Sodium
info: Atomic Number: 11. Soft, silvery-white metal, highly reactive, used in table salt.

name: Magnesium
info: Atomic Number: 12. Light metal, used in alloys, flammable, and in fireworks.

name: Aluminum
info: Atomic Number: 13. Lightweight metal, used in transportation, packaging, and electronics.

name: Silicon
info: Atomic Number: 14. Metalloid, used in electronics, solar cells, and construction materials.

name: Phosphorus
info: Atomic Number: 15. Nonmetal, used in fertilizers, detergents, and matches.

name: Sulfur
info: Atomic Number: 16. Yellow, nonmetal, used in fertilizers, vulcanization of rubber, and in sulfuric acid.

name: Chlorine
info: Atomic Number: 17. Greenish-yellow gas, used in disinfectants, pools, and bleach.

name: Argon
info: Atomic Number: 18. Noble gas, used in welding, lighting, and as an inert atmosphere.

name: Potassium
info: Atomic Number: 19. Soft, silvery metal, important in biological systems, especially in nerve function.

name: Calcium
info: Atomic Number: 20. Essential for bones and teeth, used in cement and as a reducing agent in metallurgy.

name: Scandium
info: Atomic Number: 21. Metal, used in aerospace and in the production of aluminum alloys.

name: Titanium
info: Atomic Number: 22. Strong, corrosion-resistant metal, used in aerospace, medical devices, and jewelry.

name: Vanadium
info: Atomic Number: 23. Hard, silvery metal, used in steel alloys and as a catalyst in chemical reactions.

name: Chromium
info: Atomic Number: 24. Hard, shiny metal, used in stainless steel production and in chrome plating.

name: Manganese
info: Atomic Number: 25. Hard metal, used in steel production and in batteries.

name: Iron
info: Atomic Number: 26. Strong metal, essential for the production of steel and in hemoglobin in blood.

name: Cobalt
info: Atomic Number: 27. Hard, lustrous metal, used in alloys, batteries, and in the production of pigments.

name: Nickel
info: Atomic Number: 28. Silvery metal, used in alloys, batteries, and as a catalyst.

name: Copper
info: Atomic Number: 29. Conductive metal, widely used in electrical wiring and plumbing.

name: Zinc
info: Atomic Number: 30. Metal, used in galvanizing steel, as a dietary supplement, and in batteries.

name: Gallium
info: Atomic Number: 31. Soft metal, used in electronics and in semiconductors.

name: Germanium
info: Atomic Number: 32. Metalloid, used in semiconductors and fiber optics.

name: Arsenic
info: Atomic Number: 33. Toxic metalloid, used in pesticides and wood preservation.

name: Selenium
info: Atomic Number: 34. Nonmetal, used in solar cells, electronics, and as a dietary supplement.

name: Bromine
info: Atomic Number: 35. Red-brown liquid, used in flame retardants, disinfectants, and in dyes.

name: Krypton
info: Atomic Number: 36. Noble gas, used in lighting and in high-performance insulating glass.

name: Rubidium
info: Atomic Number: 37. Soft, silvery metal, used in research and in atomic clocks.

name: Strontium
info: Atomic Number: 38. Soft metal, used in fireworks and in medical imaging.

name: Yttrium
info: Atomic Number: 39. Metal, used in electronics, phosphors, and in medical applications.

name: Zirconium
info: Atomic Number: 40. Strong, corrosion-resistant metal, used in nuclear reactors and in dental implants.

name: Niobium
info: Atomic Number: 41. Metal, used in superconducting magnets and in the aerospace industry.

name: Molybdenum
info: Atomic Number: 42. Metal, used in steel production and in electrical contacts.

name: Technetium
info: Atomic Number: 43. Synthetic element, used in medical imaging and in nuclear reactors.

name: Ruthenium
info: Atomic Number: 44. Rare metal, used in electrical contacts and in catalytic reactions.

name: Rhodium
info: Atomic Number: 45. Silver-white metal, used in catalytic converters and in jewelry.

name: Palladium
info: Atomic Number: 46. Rare metal, used in catalytic converters and in electronics.

name: Silver
info: Atomic Number: 47. Precious metal, used in jewelry, coins, and in electronics.

name: Cadmium
info: Atomic Number: 48. Toxic metal, used in batteries, pigments, and in electroplating.

name: Indium
info: Atomic Number: 49. Soft, silvery metal, used in electronics and in LCD screens.

name: Tin
info: Atomic Number: 50. Metal, used in soldering and in coatings to prevent corrosion.

name: Antimony
info: Atomic Number: 51. Metalloid, used in flame retardants, alloys, and in semiconductors.

name: Iodine
info: Atomic Number: 53. Nonmetal, used in antiseptics and in the production of iodine compounds.

name: Xenon
info: Atomic Number: 54. Noble gas, used in lamps, anesthesia, and in medical imaging.

name: Cesium
info: Atomic Number: 55. Soft metal, used in atomic clocks and in research.

name: Barium
info: Atomic Number: 56. Soft metal, used in medical imaging and in fireworks.

name: Lanthanum
info: Atomic Number: 57. Rare earth metal, used in catalysts, batteries, and in medical imaging.

name: Cerium
info: Atomic Number: 58. Rare earth metal, used in catalytic converters and in glass polishing.

name: Praseodymium
info: Atomic Number: 59. Rare earth metal, used in magnets and in alloy production.

name: Neodymium
info: Atomic Number: 60. Rare earth metal, used in powerful magnets and in lasers.

name: Promethium
info: Atomic Number: 61. Radioactive metal, used in atomic batteries and in research.

name: Samarium
info: Atomic Number: 62. Rare earth metal, used in magnets and in nuclear reactors.

name: Europium
info: Atomic Number: 63. Rare earth metal, used in fluorescent lamps and in phosphorescent materials.

name: Gadolinium
info: Atomic Number: 64. Rare earth metal, used in medical imaging and in magnetic refrigeration.

name: Terbium
info: Atomic Number: 65. Rare earth metal, used in phosphors and in fluorescent lamps.

name: Dysprosium
info: Atomic Number: 66. Rare earth metal, used in magnets and in nuclear reactors.

name: Holmium
info: Atomic Number: 67. Rare earth metal, used in lasers and in magnetic materials.

name: Erbium
info: Atomic Number: 68. Rare earth metal, used in fiber optic communication and in lasers.

name: Thulium
info: Atomic Number: 69. Rare earth metal, used in X-ray equipment and in lasers.

name: Ytterbium
info: Atomic Number: 70. Rare earth metal, used in lasers and in quantum computing.

name: Lutetium
info: Atomic Number: 71. Rare earth metal, used in PET scanners and in research.
